summary_markdown:
# About Center

Center is a financial technology company founded on January 1, 2018, that specializes in corporate spend management solutions. The company is headquartered in Washington State and focuses on integrating corporate card usage with travel booking and expense management services. Center's primary product is the CenterCard, a corporate credit card issued by Comdata, Inc., under a license from Mastercard Inc. This card is designed for business use, allowing companies to manage their corporate spending effectively [(Crunchbase, 2025)](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/centercard).

Center offers a comprehensive suite of services, including real-time expense management, travel management, customization and integration options, and data analytics. These services are aimed at providing businesses with visibility into employee spending, automating expense reporting, and streamlining accounting tasks. The company serves a diverse range of industries, helping businesses streamline their expense management processes [(Center, 2024-02-06)](https://getcenter.com/demo/).

Center's business model is primarily B2B, targeting small and medium-sized enterprises. The company generates revenue through its integrated corporate card and expense solution, which helps businesses save time, improve operations and compliance, and deliver real-time insights to finance teams for better decision-making [(Crunchbase, 2025)](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/centercard).

The company has raised a total of $101 million in funding, with the most recent round of $30 million occurring on December 5, 2023 [(Crunchbase, 2025)](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/centercard).

# Key Personnel

Center's leadership team includes experienced professionals from various sectors:

- **Naveen**: CEO with a background in financial services and product development.
- **Eugene**: CTO with extensive experience in software engineering.
- **Mo**: VP of Client Experience, previously with SAP Concur.
- **Sam**: CMO with a history of driving brand growth in technology companies.
- **Amy**: SVP of Travel Ecosystem, with over 20 years in corporate travel and expense management [(Center, 2024-02-06)](https://getcenter.com/demo/).

# News

## Recent Developments

### Terms and Conditions Update

The terms and conditions for the CenterCard services were last updated on July 15, 2024. These terms outline the responsibilities of users, including compliance with the card's intended business use and the requirement for arbitration in case of disputes [(Center, 2023-03-30)](https://getcenter.com/legal/).

### User Experience Enhancements

Center has focused on improving the user experience by integrating machine learning-powered expense management software with the CenterCard. This integration aims to simplify the travel experience and streamline expense reporting for corporate travelers [(Travelers by Director of Accounting, 2024-10-09)](https://getcenter.com/why-center/center-for-travelers/).

## Financial and Operational Insights

### Fees and Charges

While the CenterCard services are currently provided at no charge, the company reserves the right to introduce fees in the future. Users will be notified in advance of any such changes [(Center, 2023-03-30)](https://getcenter.com/legal/).

### Compliance and Security

The CenterCard is designed to ensure compliance with corporate travel policies, providing clear policy guidance and automated compliance checks during the booking process. This feature is crucial for businesses looking to maintain control over their travel expenditures [(Travelers by Director of Accounting, 2024-10-09)](https://getcenter.com/why-center/center-for-travelers/).

## Industry Insights

Center's Annual Expense Survey revealed an increase in decentralized booking habits, signaling a need for modern travel management tools. This insight highlights the evolving needs of businesses in managing their corporate travel and expenses [(Center, 2025-01-28)](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/centers-annual-expense-survey-reveals-increase-in-decentralized-booking-habits-signaling-need-for-modern-travel-management-tools-302361289.html).

# Conclusion

Center and its flagship product, CenterCard, represent a significant advancement in corporate spend management solutions. With a focus on integration, user experience, and compliance, Center is well-positioned to meet the evolving needs of businesses in managing their corporate travel and expenses. The company's innovative approach and commitment to enhancing the corporate travel experience through technology and user support reflect a strategic direction aimed at addressing the complexities faced by corporate travelers.

# Center Company Overview

## Company History
Center was founded by a team of innovators who aimed to simplify and modernize the expense reporting process. The company transitioned from traditional batch-based expensing to a real-time, card-first experience, allowing businesses to manage corporate cards, travel, and employee expenses seamlessly.

## Services
Center offers a comprehensive spend management solution that includes:

- **CenterCard® Corporate Credit Card**: A corporate card issued by Comdata, Inc., designed for business use.
  
- **Real-Time Expense Management**: Provides businesses with visibility into employee spending, automates expense reporting, and streamlines accounting tasks.

- **Travel Management**: Integrated travel booking and management services, allowing for easy itinerary changes and 24/7 support.

- **Customization and Integration**: Offers a white-label solution that can be customized with branding and integrated into existing services.

- **Data Analytics**: Provides insights into spending patterns to identify savings opportunities and enhance future programs.

## Products
- **CenterCard®**: A corporate credit card that facilitates expense management and compliance with corporate policies.
  
- **Mobile App**: Allows employees to manage expenses on-the-go, including snapping photos of receipts and submitting expenses in real-time.

## Customers
Center serves a diverse range of industries, helping businesses streamline their expense management processes. Notable customer testimonials highlight significant reductions in month-end closing times and improved efficiency in expense reporting.

## Leadership Team
Center's leadership team comprises experienced professionals from various sectors, including finance, technology, and travel management. Key members include:

- **Naveen**: CEO with a background in financial services and product development.
- **Eugene**: CTO with extensive experience in software engineering.
- **Mo**: VP of Client Experience, previously with SAP Concur.
- **Sam**: CMO with a history of driving brand growth in technology companies.
- **Amy**: SVP of Travel Ecosystem, with over 20 years in corporate travel and expense management.

## Company Culture
Center promotes a culture of innovation and customer-centricity, focusing on simplifying business processes and enhancing user experiences. The company values collaboration and aims to empower its employees and clients through technology.

## Conclusion
Center is dedicated to transforming the corporate spend management landscape by providing intuitive, real-time solutions that enhance visibility, control, and efficiency for businesses of all sizes. The company's commitment to innovation and customer satisfaction positions it as a leader in the expense management industry.

For more information, visit [Center's website](https://getcenter.com/).

# [Center Expense Management FAQ on 2023-10-16](https://getcenter.com/faq/)
Center is a corporate card and connected software solution that gives businesses real-time visibility into all employee spending, automates the traditional expensing experience and cumbersome accounting tasks, and provides finance teams with the controls and data needed for optimal decision making. Designed to be self-service and delivered via first-class deployment to ensure confidence and deliver immediate value, Center is easily customized to your accounting practices and approval workflows and delivered in a usage-based business model. Manage corporate card, corporate travel, and all employee expenses in one place with Center.

Center was founded and built by a team of innovators who knew expense reporting should be far simpler and more powerful. We modernize the expense reporting process from batch-based to in-the-moment expensing. Our card-first experience enables every employee expense to be run through corporate policies as they happen, ensuring timely approvals and month-end close. With the connected corporate card and mobile app, finance and accounting teams have the controls and visibility they need from swipe through reconciliation.

Employees swipe CenterCard and use the mobile app to snap photos of receipts, capturing details on the go. Spenders review and submit in real time, with minimal effort, leveraging auto-populated details like vendor, amount, and expense type. Admins see all employee spend as it happens—in one place—to gather insights, identify savings, and drive timely, better-informed budget decisions.

You know your business best, and you’ll always have control over who is issued a CenterCard within your organization. You can safely issue physical or virtual cards, as well as shared cards (aka procurement cards) for use by departments, teams, or projects. With Center, you can lock, unlock, and close cards with just a click, as well as easily report fraud, adjust limits, and order replacements. Check out The Ultimate Guide to Corporate Cards for more information and tips about how to administer your corporate card program.

Center helps businesses across all industries administer and manage corporate cards, corporate travel, and all employee expenses in one place. Our website highlights our top industries, but we are dedicated to helping your company simplify your expense program, regardless of industry. Our high-touch approach to deployment and ongoing support ensures immediate value and confidence in our solution. Schedule a demo today and see how Center can be customized to meet the needs of your business.

Our deployment process is designed to build confidence and ensure success, at your pace, with minimal lift. Our deployment team will customize Center to your business requirements, including configuration, validation, ERP integration, and customer approval flows. Typically you can be up and running with Center in just a few weeks. A dedicated account manager will provide ongoing support to your team, along with admin and cardholder support, 24/7, and online resources at no additional cost.

Each time you swipe CenterCard, the merchant pays a small fee to Mastercard—and that fee is shared with Center. Center is offered without annual or licensing fees or any upfront investment. For corporate travel booking, customers only pay a flat per-trip fee that includes unlimited itinerary changes, self-service cancellations and adjustments, and 24/7 omnichannel support and services.

Learn more about Center’s pricing.

Yes. Center enables companies to administer and manage corporate cards, corporate travel, and all employee expenses in one place.

Travel is typically the second highest business expense behind payroll and a historically difficult cost to control. With a fully integrated card, expense, and travel solution, companies can gain control and visibility of all employee spend—including off-of-platform bookings—and improve policy compliance across all spend categories. Our travel management experience includes travel booking through a modern user experience, comprehensive selection, competitive rates, and 24/7 omnichannel traveler services and support powered by travel platform, Spotnana.

More on our travel features

Yes, we offer personalized global travel services and support, without the fees. Easily redeem unused tickets or make unlimited itinerary changes with self-service support. If agent support is needed, we maintain staffing levels to respond quickly for traveler access to 24/7 omnichannel support from expert agents whenever needed—for guest travelers too.

With Center, travelers can experience the next generation of travel booking with a process that is as simple as shopping on their favorite website. Book trips easily, on budget, and within policy. With comprehensive selection, self-service changes, and 24/7 omnichannel support, travelers can arrange, modify, or cancel trips as well as make unlimited changes directly within the app at no additional cost.

Travelers can use our online booking tool to:

Change suppliers, dates, times, or locations

Add or change seats, loyalty number, known traveler number, and more

Cancel bookings and receive an instant refund or credit

A travel and expense policy is a set of rules that determine which travel choices are allowed for employees at the time of booking. Center allows you to manage your policy for travel bookings, travel spend, and employee expensing, all in one platform.

Center’s intelligent automation enables real-time enforcement of your business travel policies to drive greater compliance while ensuring ease and accuracy.

If you don’t currently have a travel policy in place, your dedicated Center Account Manager can assist you with creating one that fits your company’s needs.

# [Center® on 2023-03-01](https://getcenter.com/about/)
Naveen is passionate about next-generation technology rewriting the future of finance. He brings more than a decade of experience in financial services and has a deep understanding of how Center’s efforts can empower innovation across the spend management ecosystem. Naveen began his career at Concur, where he worked in product and business development. It’s also where he developed and cultivated his strong product orientation. He attended the University of San Diego and lives in Seattle with his fiancée and their dog, Jax. Outside of work, Naveen loves to travel to warm locations, is surprisingly fond of humidity, and enjoys spending time with family and friends and trying new restaurants, especially rooftop ones.

Eugene has spent more than three decades in software engineering at industry-leading global companies, with a focus on leveraging and applying consumer tech principles to enterprise software. Prior to Center, Eugene served as CTO for healthcare company Carena and developed software and systems at MSN Video, Bing Mobile, and MSN. He previously served in engineering leadership roles at Walt Disney and Starwave and founded Friday Networks, a cloud service focused on networked multimedia, mobility, and security. Eugene holds an MS in engineering from Santa Clara University and a BS in mathematical and computational sciences from Stanford University. He is a California native who has resided in the Pacific Northwest since 1994. He lives in the Seattle area with his family.

Mo has spent more than 15 years in the financial services industry and is deeply passionate about crafting and delivering world-class client experiences through thoughtful processes. Prior to Center, she served as VP for SAP Concur, where she led consultation and project management across North America’s smallest and largest customers. In previous roles, she led client-focused improvement strategy, implementation, global operations, and business process optimization for Concur and TRX. Mo holds a BS in information systems and finance from the University of Florida, Warrington College of Business. Outside of work, she and her family enjoy running and biking along Tampa Bay while juggling little league games and dance recitals.

Sam brings nearly 25 years of experience driving awareness, adoption, and revenue growth for both Fortune 100 technology companies and early-stage startups. Her career has centered on building and growing technology brands and continually optimizing processes, systems, and strategies for maximum ROI. Prior to Center, she served as CMO at healthcare technology company 98point6 and as VP of Marketing at Cozi, which she helped grow to become one of the top 10-grossing productivity apps in the App Store with more than 17 million users worldwide. Prior to Cozi, she worked in product management at Amazon, Microsoft, and Visio. Sam holds an MBA in marketing from Wake Forest University and a BA in business from the University of Maryland. She is originally from Brazil, is a competitive equestrian in eventing and show jumping, and lives on a small farm with her husband, dogs, and horses.

With over 20 years of experience in corporate travel and expense, Amy is passionate about simplifying business travel for both travelers and their companies. She began her career at UATP, the first-ever credit card, and was a founding member of the new leadership team at AirPlus International, introducing the company to the North American market. At Carlson Wagonlit Travel, she managed key business lines focused on traveler security, risk mitigation, and crisis management. In 2011, she joined Concur, helping to create and grow the Concur App Center and Concur TripLink. After ten years at Concur, she led IDEMIA's North American marketing strategy and communication programs. Amy returned to Concur in early 2023 as VP of Travel Marketing Strategy and joined Center as SVP of Travel Ecosystem in May 2024.

Amy holds a BA from George Mason University and an MBA from Virginia Commonwealth University. In 2019, she was honored as one of GBTA/WINiT’s (Women in Travel) Top 40 Women in Travel. She resides in Richmond, VA, with her husband and two dogs.

Francisco brings over a decade of experience in software engineering with a focus on scaling engineering organizations and delivering world class global products. Prior to Center, he served as CTO at Optimize Health, and as VP of Data Engineering at Inovalon. He also served in leadership roles at Restaurant Brands International, CareCloud, and InContext Solutions. Francisco holds a BA in business and management information systems from the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee. He is a Chicago native who now resides in Austin, TX with his wife Elise, and their Australian Shepherd named Kobe. When he’s not working, he enjoys traveling, golfing, basketball, and spending time with family.

Jeff brings nearly 30 years of experience in finance and investing for high-growth technology companies, including software, networking, hardware, and services. Prior to Center, he held leadership roles at Wells Capital Management, Evergreen Investments, and Mentor Investment Group. Jeff is a chartered financial analyst from the CFA Institute and received his BS in business from the Robins School of Business at the University of Richmond. Jeff is a western New York native who lives in central Virginia with his wife, Kim, and their dog, Ellie. He is a (non-current) private pilot, loves to travel, and is a long-suffering Buffalo Bills fan.

Nik is on a mission to reimagine the future of corporate payments and spend management. He is passionate about economic empowerment and leads his team in developing innovative ways to simplify, automate, and optimize the entire spend management process. Nik has a keen understanding of the financial industry and began his career as an analyst at Concur and ESL Federal Credit Union. Nik holds a BA in economics from the University of Michigan and lives in Bellevue, WA, with his wife. Together, they enjoy watching movies and going to Mexican restaurants.

Utpal brings more than a decade of experience leading corporate development, corporate strategy, and business development for global software and information technology companies including Docker, SAP, and Concur. Prior to Center, Utpal served as head of strategy and corporate development, and as chief of staff to the office of the CEO at Docker, where he drove the operational cadences of the business and led the execution of strategic partnerships and acquisitions. Prior to Docker, he focused on acquisitions, partnerships, and corporate venture investments for Concur and SAP’s Cloud Business Group. Utpal began his career as a technology investment banker at Houlihan Lokey and Merriman Capital. He holds a JD from Santa Clara University Law School and a BA in political science from the University of Michigan. Utpal lives in San Francisco with his wife and two children.

Comdata will provide Customer with one or more accounts through the use of which Customer may access certain card networks (“Networks”), and the financial information and other services provided for in this Agreement and any Schedules attached hereto (collectively, the “Account”). In connection with the Account, Comdata, in accordance with Customer’s request, will provide special Comdata®MasterCard Corporate Cards®, which may include fleet, purchasing, T&E, multi cards and virtual cards (collectively, “Cards”), and which are issued by Regions Bank, headquartered in Birmingham, Alabama, or another financial institution (“Issuing Bank”). Comdata is an agent or representative of Issuing Bank or its affiliates. All Cards issued to Customer shall remain the property of the Issuing Bank and must be returned or destroyed (with certification of destruction) upon request. Comdata or the Issuing Bank may cancel, revoke, repossess or restrict the use of Cards at any time.

2. Customer Representations and Warranties. Customer represents and warrants the following:

Customer is either a governmental, non-profit or commercial enterprise, and the Account and Cards will not be used for personal, household or consumer purposes;

the Account and Cards will be used for legitimate business charges only and Customer will have neither consumer law rights nor remedies available to consumers associated with any purchases, charges or other activity associated with the Cards;

the Account and cards will only be used to make payments on behalf of Customer and will not be used to make payments on behalf of any third party;

the Account and Cards will only be used for valid and lawful purposes and will not be used for gambling, online gaming, illicit drug transactions, or any unlawful purposes including without limitation (i) other illegal purchases of goods or services, regardless of whether such transaction violates the laws applicable in the territory where the transaction was initiated or merchant is located, or (ii) purchases that are prohibited by local law; and

the Account and Cards will not be used in any way that would cause Comdata or Issuing Bank to violate applicable Law.

If Customer uses, or allows someone else to use, the Account or Cards in violation of the above representations and warranties, Customer shall be responsible for such use and may be required to reimburse Comdata, the Issuing Bank, and MasterCard International Incorporated (“MasterCard”) for all amounts or expenses either Comdata, the Issuing Bank or MasterCard pays as a result of such use.

3. Integration Partner; Authorization. Customer has entered into a separate agreement with Center ID Corp. (“Integration Partner”) pursuant to which Integration Partner provides Account management services to Customer. In connection with such agreement with Integration Partner and this Agreement, Customer authorizes Comdata to provide Integration Partner with (i) access to Customer’s Account, including certain administrative functions, and (ii) Customer’s transaction data. Customer acknowledges and agrees that Comdata shall have no liability for any actions of Integration Partner with respect to the Account(s) and Customer agrees to indemnify and hold harmless Comdata from any damages, liabilities, costs or expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees and litigation costs) arising out of or in connection with any action by Integration Partner with respect to the Account(s).

4. Credit Limit; Credit Information. If applicable, Comdata will establish a credit limit for the Account. The credit limit is subject to periodic review and adjustment by Comdata in its sole discretion. Customer shall provide Comdata with such financial information as Comdata may reasonably require, including, without limitation, annual financial statements within a reasonable time after Customer’s fiscal year-end and interim financial statements as requested by Comdata. Customer authorizes Comdata to make any credit investigation Comdata deems necessary and appropriate and to request reports from credit bureaus in connection with this Agreement or any update, renewal or extension of credit.

Comdata may furnish information with respect to Customer’s Account to credit bureaus or others who may properly receive such information. Customer shall repay Comdata for all credit extended by Comdata and shall not allow its unpaid balance, including unbilled transactions, fees and other charges on the Account, to exceed its credit limit at any time. If Customer exceeds its credit limit, then Comdata may require immediate payment, suspend further Service, and assess additional fees.

5. Security. From time to time Comdata may request Customer to provide security for the performance when due of Customer’s obligations hereunder. Customer understands and agrees that it is under no obligation to provide Comdata with such security, but the refusal to provide security when requested may result in adverse credit determinations by Comdata. Any security provided shall be in the amount and form as required by Comdata in its reasonable discretion. The Account will not be available to Customer until such security is accepted by Comdata in its sole discretion.

6. Payment Terms. (a) Non-Revolving. Customer shall be responsible for credit extended on the Account. This is not a revolving credit account and the total amount shown on each Account statement (the “Total Amount Due”) is due and payable by the date shown on the Account statement. This amount includes transactions posted since the last statement date, applicable account and service fees, amounts past due, late payment charges, charges for returned checks and other applicable charges. For international transactions, the transaction amount includes a MasterCard cross-border fee (currently 90 basis points) and a MasterCard currency conversion assessment fee (currently 20 basis points), which are subject to change in MasterCard’s sole discretion.

(a) Late Fee and Default Interest. If Customer does not make full payment of the Total Amount Due on the due date, then Customer shall pay a late payment fee equal to the greater of: (i) $150 or (ii) 9.99% of the past due portion of the Total Amount Due (excluding any previous late fees and any default interest charges). In no event will such late charge exceed the lesser of $5,000 or the maximum amount permitted by applicable law. In addition, in the event the Total Amount Due is not paid by the due date, then Comdata may assess a default interest charge at a rate equal to the weekly average prime loan rate as published by the Federal Reserve plus 4% per annum. The default interest is assessed on the Total Amount Due (excluding any late fees and any previous default interest charges) for the period of time such amount remains unpaid beyond the due date. In no event will the default interest rate exceed the greater of 8% per annum or the maximum rate permitted by applicable law.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, no late fee or default interest charge will be applicable if the unpaid amount on the Account is less than $75.

(c) Returned Payment. Comdata reserves the right to charge a returned payment fee of twenty dollars ($20) or the maximum amount permitted under applicable law, whichever is less.

7. Statements; Reporting. Billing statements and reports are available on-line. Customer understands and agrees that Comdata’s ability to provide complete reporting information to Customer (or Integration Partner) is dependent on merchant providing complete purchase detail to Comdata.

8. Term; Termination. This Agreement is for an initial term of one (1) year, commencing on the date this Agreement is executed by Comdata. After the initial term, this Agreement shall continue until one party provides the other party with thirty (30) days written notice of termination.

Comdata may immediately terminate this Agreement and the Account in the event the Network prohibits the Account, the Issuing Bank ceases to be a network member or the Issuing Bank ceases to be the Card issuer, provided that Comdata shall endeavor to provide Customer with advance notice of any such event. In the event of Customer’s breach or default under the credit limit and payment terms of this Agreement, Comdata shall have the right to immediately suspend the Account until such breach is cured. In the event such breach or default is not cured within a reasonable period of time, Comdata may thereafter terminate the Agreement. In the event of any other default under this Agreement by either party, the nondefaulting party shall provide the defaulting party written notice of the nature of the default. The defaulting party shall have thirty (30) days from the date of the default notice to cure the default, and if the default is not cured within such time period, then the non-defaulting party may thereafter terminate this Agreement with written notice. In addition to any other rights of termination, either party may terminate this Agreement upon prior written notice with respect to any individual state or jurisdiction if the terminating party can demonstrate, with documentary support, that changes in applicable laws or regulations or the interpretation thereof will make the performance of such party’s obligations hereunder not commercially feasible. The effective date of termination under the preceding sentence will be ninety (90) days from the date notice is delivered, or upon the effective date of the new law or regulation, whichever occurs sooner. Customer’s obligation to pay for all outstanding amounts incurred before the effective date of termination shall survive termination. The effective date of termination under the preceding sentence will be ninety (90) days from the date notice is delivered, or upon the effective date of the new law or regulation, whichever occurs sooner. Customer’s obligation to pay for all outstanding amounts incurred before the effective date of termination shall survive termination.

9. Disputed Items. Comdata must be notified by Customer or Customer’s representative in writing of any disputed item on Customer’s billing statement within sixty (60) days from the date of the billing statement, or it will be deemed undisputed and accepted by Customer. Unless required by law, Comdata is not responsible for any problem Customer may have with any goods or services charged on the Account. If Customer has a dispute with a merchant, Customer must pay Comdata and attempt to resolve the dispute with the merchant prior to sending the dispute to Comdata. If Customer is unsuccessful in resolving the dispute directly with the merchant, Comdata will attempt to process the dispute through MasterCard subject to the MasterCard rules, as they may be changed from time to time in MasterCard’s sole discretion. # [Center Embedded](https://embedded.getcenter.com)
CUSTOMIZE

Your look & feel without the lift

Our white-label solution sets itself apart by offering a highly intuitive and powerful real-time expensing experience customers love. It's ready to go out of the box and can be easily customized with your branding and effortlessly integrated into your services.

Need more customization? Our solution is developer-friendly, with flexible components and APIs for crafting unique experiences. Our comprehensive set of tools ensures your team can deploy, manage, and excel at every step

Differentiated value, no lift

Remove key friction from swipe-to-GL, deliver a turnkey admin experience, gain proactive spend controls for confident growth, get plug and play technical integration (accounting/ERP/HRIS), and onboard, deploy, and activate customers efficiently.

Launch in weeks, not years

We've built software with proven scale so that you don't have to—from sandbox to deployment. Customize our prebuilt solution or craft unique experiences with our APIs, with a speedy path to market. Tailer workflows and expense forms to meet the needs of every segment.

Leverage robust data sets

Business spending generates valuable data, including detailed booking and material purchase information. Increase visibility of spend to identify cross-selling opportunites and future program enhancements.

Tools that guide you every step of the way

Simplify deployment and onboarding with centralized support tools for diagnostics and management of fraud, disputes, account statements, card lifecycle, and declines.

Want to learn more?

Get in touch with us to learn more about how Center Embedded can help you.

Get in touch

# [USA PATRIOT Act on 2023-03-30](https://getcenter.com/USAPATRIOTAct)
Last updated 8/19/19

To help the government fight the funding of terrorism and money laundering activities, Federal law requires all financial institutions to obtain, verify and record information that identifies each business who opens an account and the personal information of its owners and/or authorized representatives. In opening a Center account this means that in addition to information about the business entity, we will also ask for identifying information about the business owner and any other individuals associated with the account. Such information will include the name, address, date of birth, social security number, tax status and other information that will allow appropriate identification to be made. We may also ask to see copies of driver’s licenses or other identifying material as part of the verification process.

Employee Cards may only be created for individuals of whom the business entity has validated the identity, using commercially acceptable screening methods such as employment screening and background checks and from whom business entity has acceptable documentation on file for the validation of the employee cardholder’s identity. Center reserves the right to request information and/or documentation to validate any employee cardholder’s identity if necessary and to close any employee cardholder’s Card if the cardholder’s identity cannot be validated and/or if issuing a Card to any individual may be a violation of the USA PATRIOT Act or any other applicable law.

# Center, founded 2018-01-01 [(Crunchbase, 2025)](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/centercard)
Center is a software company helping businesses gain visibility into and manage employee spending.

Center Expense is an integrated corporate card and expense solution used by small and medium-sized enterprises to save time, improve operations and compliance, and deliver real-time insights to finance teams for better decision-making.

- [Website](https://getcenter.com)
- [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/getcenter)
- [Twitter](https://twitter.com/GetCenterHQ)

## Funding (101M USD total)

- 30M USD on 2023-12-05
- 15M USD on 2022-10-26
- 49M USD on 2021-08-24
- 7M USD on 2020-04-13

# Negative Sentiment

## Performance Issues
- "It’s by far the worst credit card expense app I’ve ever used. It is very slow and glitchy." [(Akabat, Apple App Store, 2024-08-11)](https://apple/11599033802)
- "Regardless of your internet speed you spend so much time watching the application spin and think." [(Samoore627, Apple App Store, 2024-10-29)](https://apple/11890344525)
- "This has to be the slowest app I’ve ever seen." [(Ghuyteddj n, Apple App Store, 2024-11-13)](https://apple/11945685001)
- "Good app, but it’s slow." [(Big Al3, Apple App Store, 2023-12-14)](https://apple/10695727513)

## Bugs and Glitches
- "App has a bug. When I click an expense to submit it, the app closes out." [(Jeremy Baird, Google Play Store, 2023-05-16)](https://google_play/4c316b67-c9d0-438b-9b09-3f5b3154f0bc)
- "App will not open if other apps are already open on phone." [(Rhys Rootes, Google Play Store, 2022-08-08)](https://google_play/b0776433-5409-4d03-9683-c52292328dac)
- "The app is constantly refreshing/updating in the middle of filling out an expense." [(Chief Finance dudeeee, Apple App Store, 2024-09-03)](https://apple/11683495164)
- "The bugs in this app drive me insane." [(theboss87424, Apple App Store, 2024-05-31)](https://apple/11327778209)

# Suggestions for Improvement

## User Experience
- "I would appreciate a way to load all expenses into a monthly report and be able to hit submit once instead of having to do it for each individual expense/receipt etc." [(QueenFVF, Apple App Store, 2024-02-02)](https://apple/10893299564)

# Positive Sentiment

## Ease of Use
- "Super easy expense report submission. It’s unlike the process I’ve had at other companies." [(Kate S. 98765432, Apple App Store, 2022-01-26)](https://apple/8286268977)
- "Center makes it so easy to submit my expenses." [(Stephpatl1, Apple App Store, 2022-11-21)](https://apple/9314718188)

## Features
- "Great pop up alerts, auto-populating expenses at time of transaction, learning expense fields, unlimited customizable fields." [(E Wade, Apple App Store, 2022-06-10)](https://apple/8760206852)

# I love Center, 5 stars [(Kate S. 98765432, Apple App Store, 2022-01-26)](https://apple/8286268977)
Super easy expense report submission. 
It’s unlike the process I’ve had at other companies. I’m not going into excel and populating spreadsheets and gathering receipts.
I have my CenterCard loaded into many of my recurring charges so when I see that charge occur I’ll pull down the receipt and pop it into Center Expense or Center mobile app and press submit. Or if I’m on the road I’ll swipe, take a pic of the receipt, and press submit. 
It’s the new way of doing expense reports and I love it.

reviews.pros: Smaller company makes it easy to build connections

reviews.advice: Be reasonable, have compassion, be fair, be ethical, and do the right thing.
reviews.cons:
I was recruited for this job while still employed at another company. Unless you're one of the 'well liked' employees, feedback and suggestions are not welcomed. 
I was told that I was doing a great job; gift cards, company-wide recognition, etc. and then out of the blue, I was put on a Performance Improvement Plan. 
The new metrics for my PIP, were completely unattainable. I was asked to increase the number of meetings, by almost 50%, even though my peers were asked to do 50% less. 
I was given Hawaii and the Dakotas as my territories; states with significantly smaller populations and less business per capita- making my PIP even harder to attain. 
After the month ended, I was in the top 80% of my 20 person cohort; despite the majority of my peers underperforming, I was still fired. 
I'm not sure what other departments are like, but if you are headed into sales at Center I would highly advise against it.
reviews.pros:
My peers were amazing and very supportive. 
Despite being remote, I never felt like I was on an island.
reviews.summary: No Regard For Kids, Family, or a Healthy Work-Life Balance

reviews.advice: Invest in demand gen and marketing more
reviews.cons: Center has a pipeline challenge which can make hitting your number difficult.
reviews.pros: The Sales team and Leaders actually care and want everyone to succeed and we have a hard working group. There is a good amount of collaboration and I have learned alot in my time here.

reviews.cons: look at leadership's history. The experience is limited and turnover displays some red flags that should have been caught earlier.
reviews.pros: They were trying to attract top talent with generous benefits. I doubt that will stick around.

reviews.cons:
Upper management is inexperienced and doesn't communicate well across the company.
Tons of nepotism / cliques. If you're not in the in-group, you're screwed.
General lack of vision and strategy, following the competition more than setting their own path. 
Sales org is competent, but product and engineering are a mess.
reviews.pros:
Decent work-life balance.
North America timezones.
reviews.summary: Heed the warnings and stay away

reviews.advice: We hit this milestone because of the folks who weathered the layoffs. Their resilience played a pivotal role in our success, and this is the way to treat them.
reviews.cons:
The drama of an unwarranted layoff began with favoritism. The VP now wields more authority than the CTO.
They just want to use you for the bare minimum the market demands in terms of salary.
When you seek guidance for career advancement, the manager comes up empty-handed with no concrete plans in sight.
A yes-man manager, feeling threatened, is ready to sacrifice top-performing employees by throwing them under the bus. Since the layoff, there has been a noticeable decline in software quality, and deployments have become dysfunctional.
reviews.pros:
Paycheck's always on time.
A good manager willing to take a pay cut to save the team members.
Teamwork. Anticipate a surge of positive reviews from the marketing team to offset the overall review score.
The potential value of stock options might increase due to the CEO's father being a widely recognized business man.

reviews.cons: In the hybrid environment, there are fewer opportunities to get everyone together in person which I miss, but we've been able to cultivate a strong culture even being remote.
reviews.pros: Great people, culture, and opportunity to grow. These people are my family and going to work each day excites me to be able to solve problems with them.

reviews.advice: Take courses on leadership. It’s evident most leaders have never sat in a leadership role and have a poor level of execution, direction, and professionalism.
reviews.cons: Not an innovative product - incapable of keeping up with the competition yet have unrealistic expectations on meeting KPIs. Are unclear on what the KPI expectations are and do not take the time to cover how to achieve goals. No 401k match. Very unprofessional leadership that do not care about your best interest and have created a very toxic work environment. Comp structure not advantageous or achievable. Leaders are not willing to hear new ideas or new concepts. Show favoritism and give special privileges to specific employees. High level of micromanagement. No diverse thoughts amongst leadership - they are trying to recreate a Concur 2.0 which makes no sense given the size and stage of the organization. No opportunity for promotions.
reviews.pros: Very good support on the actual product.

reviews.cons: No cons come to mind.
reviews.pros: Center is a fantastic company.

reviews.cons: you are working for a family start up and promotions are based on family name and not based on talent or performance.
reviews.pros: One person makes decisions. Pivoted into a direction that the family knows very well.

reviews.cons: No 401k match right now
reviews.pros: Phenomenal culture, room for growth, promising future

reviews.advice: stop working to get promoted.  help us succeed by collaborating together instead of competing with each other for territory.
reviews.cons:
communication is completely broken.
leadership teams meet and make decisions that impact the team in a vacuum.  instead of collaboration, there is accusations.
reviews.pros: incredibly confusing place to work.  the clearest guidance we get are customer escalations to executives - then the priority of what happens next is clear.

reviews.advice: Take courses on how to manage and not just be cheerleaders. Anyone can do that.
reviews.cons:
-Micromanagers, can’t trust anyone, barely anyone hits quota. 
-Lots and lots of prospecting. 
-There are several KPI’s they look at but don’t tell you about.
-Pay is low compared to competitors. -Boys club, a big popularity contest where males are favored. 
-No one knows who Center is.
reviews.pros: They do actually help customers

reviews.advice: Leave the company.
reviews.cons: This business operates essentially as a family venture, lacking qualified personnel in leadership positions. While there are professional and experienced employees within the company, unfortunately, the management is lacking. Their decisions seem to change almost weekly, causing inconsistency and confusion.
reviews.pros: There are no discernible benefits or advantages to working here.

reviews.cons: Not enough internal growth here
reviews.pros: Great people in the office

reviews.cons: No 401k match, but that is to be expected with a smaller start up at this stage. The paternity leave could be better in comparison to the industry.
reviews.pros: Great teamwork culture. A place where everyone wants to achieve and hit their goals to better the company. I enjoy being around people who strive for success. Great opportunities for those that are good performers and are patient to make the move when the timing is right for the growing company. I am very optimistic for the company's future.

reviews.cons: The comp is decent. No yearly raises
reviews.pros: People, culture, growth, opportunity, work life balance

reviews.advice: Keep it up

reviews.pros: Culture, people, comp, and growth

reviews.cons: They only care about numbers and creating revenue- they have zero respect or care for their employees, unless they are performing above and beyond.
reviews.pros: They are a growing company.
reviews.summary: No Care For Employees Unless Performing Above and Beyond

reviews.advice: Let's keep building out the product and become a big business.
reviews.cons:
The headquarters is in dated space but it sounds like new space is on the horizon.

The product is moving through beta stage now;  it will be nice to see the product move into the marketplace in the next few months and get traction
reviews.pros:
The product development team has grown (with almost no turnover) without sacrificing culture.  There is a strong team approach to building product.  There really are no nasty people here.  And we are gaining really cool expertise in the fintech space.

We work hard but the company still allows a work/life balance.  We can work from home when necessary, there is a self-directed PTO policy (you decide vacation amount), good healthcare benefits and a 401k.  And free parking.

Pay is good for a startup.  

The founder, Steve Singh, is a visionary in the software space

The CEO has a clear vision on what our product of the future looks like and how we get there.

The company is growing to fill out key needs--there are still some positions that are being filled now.  Think the company will be significantly larger a year from now.
reviews.summary: Center is marrying a corporate card and software to improve & automate financial applications

# Employee Sentiments

## Positive Sentiments

### Reasons Employees Like Working for Center
- "The product development team has grown (with almost no turnover) without sacrificing culture. There is a strong team approach to building product." [(Finance, Glassdoor, 2018-11-13)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW23400221.htm)
- "Culture, people, comp, and growth." [(Account Manager, Glassdoor, 2022-12-08)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW71725282.htm)
- "Great teamwork culture. A place where everyone wants to achieve and hit their goals to better the company." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2023-09-29)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW80522664.htm)
- "Phenomenal culture, room for growth, promising future." [(Senior Account Manager, Glassdoor, 2024-03-21)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW85589433.htm)
- "Great people, culture, and opportunity to grow." [(Sales Director, Glassdoor, 2024-05-02)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW86891112.htm)

### Work-Life Balance and Benefits
- "We work hard but the company still allows a work/life balance. We can work from home when necessary, there is a self-directed PTO policy (you decide vacation amount), good healthcare benefits and a 401k." [(Finance, Glassdoor, 2018-11-13)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW23400221.htm)
- "Decent work-life balance." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2024-09-13)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW90993642.htm)

### Company Growth and Leadership
- "The CEO has a clear vision on what our product of the future looks like and how we get there." [(Finance, Glassdoor, 2018-11-13)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW23400221.htm)
- "Center is a fantastic company." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2024-04-17)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW86424193.htm)

## Negative Sentiments

### Reasons Employees Dislike Working for Center
- "They only care about numbers and creating revenue- they have zero respect or care for their employees, unless they are performing above and beyond." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2022-06-21)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW65824581.htm)
- "Promotions are based on family name and not based on talent or performance." [(Software Developer, Glassdoor, 2020-10-25)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW37586709.htm)
- "Upper management is inexperienced and doesn't communicate well across the company." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2024-09-13)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW90993642.htm)

### Key Events or Changes in the Company
- "The drama of an unwarranted layoff began with favoritism." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2024-02-25)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW84732663.htm)
- "There is a good amount of collaboration and I have learned a lot in my time here." [(Account Executive, Glassdoor, 2024-12-05)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW93422100.htm)

### Specific Details About Benefits
- "No 401k match, but that is to be expected with a smaller startup at this stage." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2023-09-29)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW80522664.htm)
- "No yearly raises." [(Deployment Manager, Glassdoor, 2023-07-26)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-RVW78589375.htm)

## Management and Leadership Concerns
- "Very unprofessional leadership that do not care about your best interest and have created a very toxic work environment." [(Business Development, Glassdoor, 2023-10-26)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Center-R

# [Center® on 2023-03-30](https://getcenter.com/legal/)
CenterCard® Spend Management Services Terms and Conditions

CenterCard® Spend Management Services Terms and Conditions

Last Updated Date: 7/15/2024

Thank you for your interest in the CenterCard® spend management services. These CenterCard® Spend Management Services Terms and Conditions (“Terms and Conditions”) apply to your use of the Services provided by Center ID Corp. (“Center”, “we” or “our”). By submitting an Application or by using the Services, you agree to be bound by the Agreement (defined below), which includes these Terms and Conditions. We may update these Terms and Conditions without prior written notice at any time and in our sole discretion by posting an updated version on our Site (defined below). Any updates or changes to these Terms and Conditions will be in effect as of the “Last Updated Date” referenced above. Your continued use of the Site, Card(s) or Services after the “Last Updated Date” will constitute your acceptance of and agreement to such updates. If you do not agree to the Agreement or these Terms and Conditions, or if you do not agree to any updates to these Terms and Conditions, do not use the App, Card(s) or Services.

You acknowledge and agree that the Card will not be treated as a consumer card under the provisions of state and federal law. The Issuer will assume that all Card Transactions will be for business purposes.

THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS REQUIRE THE USE OF ARBITRATION TO RESOLVE DISPUTES, RATHER THAN JURY TRIALS. YOU AGREE THAT ANY CLAIMS, CAUSES OF ACTION, REMEDIES OR DISPUTES BETWEEN YOU AND CENTER RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT WILL BE RESOLVED BY BINDING, INDIVIDUAL ARBITRATION, AND YOU ARE WAIVING YOUR RIGHT TO A TRIAL BY JURY OR TO PARTICIPATE AS A PLAINTIFF OR CLASS MEMBER IN ANY PURPORTED CLASS ACTION OR REPRESENTATIVE PROCEEDING.

Definitions.

As used herein:

“Administrator” means an employee of Company, such as a cost center manager or finance manager, designated by Company to be responsible for tracking usage of the Cards and Company’s participation in the Program.

“Affiliate” means an entity or entities directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by, or under common control with a party to these Terms and Conditions and “control” means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of a controlled entity, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise.

“Agreement” means, collectively these Terms and Conditions, the Terms of Use, the Card Account Agreement and our Privacy Policy, as each may be updated or amended from time to time.

“App” means the CenterCard mobile and/or web applications.

“Application” means the CenterCard MasterCard® Corporate Card and Account Program Application.

“Card” means a debit or credit payment access device issued to Company that is branded with a Center trademark, as provided in Center’s sole discretion. A Card may include fleet, purchasing, T&E, multi cards, ghost cards, virtual cards, or any other debit or credit payment vehicle issued by Center that is connected to a digital or mobile wallet.

“Card Account Agreement” means the Comdata MasterCard Corporate Card Account Agreement between the Issuer and the Company, as updated or amended by Issuer from time to time.

“Card Transaction” means a transaction made using a Card.

“Center Information” means all proprietary information of Center used in the provision or receipt of the Services or Program, including Software, documents, drawings, data, code, and System created, or otherwise owned, by Center or licensed by Center from third parties related to the Services, Software, Documentation, System, or Program and all modifications thereof, and all intellectual property rights therein. “Center Information” also includes the foregoing types of information of Center’s Third Party Providers to which Company or Company’s employees receive access.

“Company“, “you” or “your” means the entity that submitted an executed Application and has been approved for use of the Services.

“Company Data” means, other than Resultant Data, information, data and other content, in any form or medium, that is collected, downloaded or otherwise received, directly or indirectly from Company, a Company Affiliate or any User by or through the Program or related services or that incorporates or is derived from the processing of such information, data or content by or through the Program or related services.

“Company Information” means all confidential or proprietary information and data provided to Center by Company or any User.

“Confidential Information” means any non-public information of a party, or, with respect to Center’s Confidential Information, a Third Party Provider, which a party designates in writing as being confidential when it is disclosed, or which, given the nature of the information or circumstances in which it is provided, should be treated as confidential. Confidential Information of a party includes but is not limited to, business plans, business methods, financial information, products, services, data, specifications, documentation, inventions, processes, trade secrets, know-how, customers, designs, drawings, computer code, algorithms, formulas, passwords and the terms of the Agreement. Confidential Information does not include information which: (a) was rightfully in the possession of the receiving party prior to receiving it from the disclosing party; (b) is independently developed by the receiving party without use of or reliance upon the Confidential Information of the disclosing party; (c) was in the public domain at or subsequent to the time of disclosure (through no breach of the receiving party); or (d) is obtained in good faith from a third party not under any obligation of confidentiality.

“Documentation” means any Program materials that Center makes generally available to its customers, either online or in electronic or hard copy format.

“Effective Date” has the meaning set forth in Section 9.1.

“Fees” has the meaning set forth in Section 4.2.

“Issuer” and “Issuing Bank” means the financial institution that issues the Cards. Solely for purposes of these Terms and Conditions, Issuer also refers to Comdata Inc.

“License” has the meaning set forth in Section 2.4.

“Password(s)” means the confidential passwords or other means that allows User(s) to access and use the Software and Services.

“Privacy Policy” means the Center Privacy Policy posted to the Site, as such policy may be updated or amended from time to time.

“Program” means the Services, and the Cards, Software and System used to provide such Services.

“Resultant Data” means information, data and other content that is derived by or through the Program, Services or from processing Company Data and is sufficiently different from such Company Data that such Company Data cannot be reverse engineered or otherwise identified from the inspection, analysis or further processing of such information, data or content.

“Services” means the CenterCard spend management and corporate Card services described in the Agreement and all other services provided by Center or its Third Party Providers to Company and its Users pursuant to the Program or the Agreement. “Services” also includes all services accessed by Company or Users through the System or otherwise under these Terms and Conditions that are provided, either directly or on a pass-through basis, by Third Party Providers.

“Services Fees” has meaning given in Section 4.2.

# Comprehensive Analyst Report on Center and CenterCard

## Company Overview: Center

Center ID Corp., commonly referred to as Center, is a financial technology company that specializes in providing corporate spend management solutions. The company is headquartered in Washington State and operates under a business model that integrates corporate card usage with travel booking and expense management services. Center aims to streamline the financial processes for businesses, enhancing efficiency and compliance in corporate spending.

### Key Information

- **Headquarters**: Washington State
- **Business Model**: Financial technology focusing on corporate spend management
- **Core Product**: CenterCard, a corporate credit card integrated with travel and expense management solutions

## Product Overview: CenterCard

The CenterCard is a corporate credit card issued by Comdata, Inc., under a license from Mastercard Inc. It is designed specifically for business use, allowing companies to manage their corporate spending effectively. The card is part of a broader suite of services that includes travel booking and expense management, providing a unified solution for corporate travel needs.

### Key Features of CenterCard

- **Business Use Only**: The card is strictly for business purposes and will not be treated as a consumer card under state and federal law [(Center, 2024-02-06)](https://getcenter.com/demo/).
- **Integration with Travel Services**: CenterCard is integrated with a travel booking platform, allowing users to manage travel itineraries and expenses seamlessly [(Travelers by Director of Accounting, 2024-10-09)](https://getcenter.com/why-center/center-for-travelers/).
- **Real-Time Expense Tracking**: Users can capture receipts and submit expenses on-the-go, ensuring accurate and timely reporting [(Travelers by Director of Accounting, 2024-10-09)](https://getcenter.com/why-center/center-for-travelers/).
- **24/7 Support**: Center provides round-the-clock assistance to users, enhancing the overall user experience [(Travelers by Director of Accounting, 2024-10-09)](https://getcenter.com/why-center/center-for-travelers/).

## Recent Developments

### Terms and Conditions Update

The terms and conditions for the CenterCard services were last updated on July 15, 2024. These terms outline the responsibilities of users, including compliance with the card's intended business use and the requirement for arbitration in case of disputes [(Center, 2023-03-30)](https://getcenter.com/legal/).

### User Experience Enhancements

Center has focused on improving the user experience by integrating machine learning-powered expense management software with the CenterCard. This integration aims to simplify the travel experience and streamline expense reporting for corporate travelers [(Travelers by Director of Accounting, 2024-10-09)](https://getcenter.com/why-center/center-for-travelers/).

## Financial and Operational Insights

### Fees and Charges

While the CenterCard services are currently provided at no charge, the company reserves the right to introduce fees in the future. Users will be notified in advance of any such changes [(Center, 2023-03-30)](https://getcenter.com/legal/).

### Compliance and Security

The CenterCard is designed to ensure compliance with corporate travel policies, providing clear policy guidance and automated compliance checks during the booking process. This feature is crucial for businesses looking to maintain control over their travel expenditures [(Travelers by Director of Accounting, 2024-10-09)](https://getcenter.com/why-center/center-for-travelers/).

## Executive Insights

While specific executive quotes were not available in the reviewed articles, the overall messaging from Center emphasizes a commitment to enhancing the corporate travel experience through technology and user support. The focus on a unified solution for travel and expense management reflects a strategic direction aimed at addressing the complexities faced by corporate travelers.

## Conclusion

Center and its flagship product, CenterCard, represent a significant advancement in corporate spend management solutions. With a focus on integration, user experience, and compliance, Center is well-positioned to meet the evolving needs of businesses in managing their corporate travel and expenses. Prospective candidates and investors should consider the company's innovative approach and the potential for growth in the financial technology sector.
